title: Amazing app
text: Wow this is an amazing app. It’s the perfect level of simple but also has the features that let you do anything. Such a caring development team too, support is incredible! Thank you Habit!

title: LOVE the calendar widget!!
text: I use this app to keep track of the workouts I’ve done in a week, and I love the calendar widget that lets me see my consistency over the month. It keeps me motivated! Plus I can click straight into the app from the widget!

title: Bad color options and fonts
text: Can hardly see text

title: Please Use It!!!!
text: This is a simple app that helps with making habits! You can choose how much water, steps while walking, read, etc and YOU get to choose how much water or whatever you want. Please use this if you need to start habits.

title: Best Habit Tracker
text: I seriously appreciate how this app makes it super easy to show my therapist what I’ve been up to — or not — without feeling awkward or ashamed. I can just hand over my phone, and they get a clear view of what’s been going on. The mood tracker is a game changer for the same reason; it gives my therapist a quick snapshot of how I’ve been feeling. Plus, the customer service is amazing. If you’re thinking about getting this app, do it!

title: So good
text: Has really helped me improve my daily life, but I wish that you could get more habits to build or like stop with free but cause I’m a user other than that an amazing app

title: FAVORITE
text: New favorite app.

title: Perfect interface!
text: I love the look of this app and the developers made it so intuitive and let you change/customize all of your settings! I’ve been on the hunt for a good tracker/calendar and this checks all the boxes for me!

title: 好
text: 可以轻松管理每日目标，提升自律力支持 表盘小组件、桌面小组件，随时查看进度，更有详细数据分析助你坚持到底

title: GOOD!
text: This app is very useful it actually makes you do the stuff you want to do and it is very organized you can set goals for yourself like reading, exercising and more

title: Such a nice app!
text: Usually I never write reviews but I love this app. I was using my notes app on my iPhone & found it so so boring. I wanted more color but still wanted it minimalist. It’s beautiful. Especially in the dark theme. & I am so glad when I made my To Do list … it carried onto the following days. Phew. It’s worth the buy & the Pro. :)

title: Satisfied Customer!!
text: I found this habit tracker as an easy to use tool that was not expensive! Customer Service is 💯💯💯and when I had issues with the app I contacted customer support and they were on it! Had the problem fix with a quick update in no time! The app is easy to use, affordable, cute and satisfying to complete each task! I love paper planners but it’s the little things we do each day that make the biggest difference!  Little habits done each day keeps me being successful and productive! I absolutely love it and 💯 satisfied! & Thank you again for the quick support! 🙏🏽It helps my stay on top of my goals!

title: Good
text: Good

title: EVERYTHING I HAVE EVER WANTED IN A HABIT TRACKER!!
text: Finally!! I have tried so many and this is THE ONE! Everything I need in a habit tracker!! Love everything! Great Home Screen widget! Very customizable without being overwhelming.

title: App
text: It good you can make your  own habits but I wish there more pictures you could chose from like there was nothing for cheer so I used and emoji and it was still only a girl doing at cartwheel so not happy about that

title: LOVE IT OBSESSED
text:
Helped me stay fit and join the track team! I use it every afternoon ✨😃 
Thank you for creating this app! 🥰❤️❤️

title: Do it!
text: Easy to use and has made my life easier to manage and set my own expectations better

title: Language
text: Please add more languages (Spanish, Italian, french and more...) Thanks

title: Look nice, but unusable
text:
I downloaded this app solely to check off days that I didn’t have a drink. The app seemed easy enough to navigate, but I ended up being so frustrated just trying to do this one thing. 

The habit/goal kept showing whenever I tapped on a calendar day, and I don’t know why I couldn’t just un-tap it. I went to the FAQ and it said I needed to go to the Habit Manager, but that was for removing the habit completely. I finally got it to take me to the page showing my weekly goal, which was showing as complete even though it wasn’t. I had to manually visit each day and use the reset option. 

After all of that, I ended up creating the habit from scratch to make sure I got the settings right, and the same thing happened again. I went ahead and uninstalled it after that. 

I’m fairly tech savvy and can usually work out new apps and interfaces without too much trouble. So, chalk it up to human error, but I don’t think it should be so confusing for an average person like me to check a box on a calendar.

title: Love
text: Love this app just wish that the timing for every day the week would be a little bit more efficient.

title: Add more features to take premium
text: In the custom habit under the time range you have only features like anytime,  morning, afternoon and evening..please make it more customisable like time of the day..start and end date..it’s really necessary to build some habits that needs to be done in the specific time of the day even though you have provided reminders

title: Charged Twice for Lifetime Membership
text:
Response to developer: I submitted a refund request twice and chatted with two Apple reps. They told me the thing I paid $6.99 for wasn’t a lifetime subscription and that by paying $8.99 I was upgrading. That’s not true as you know. Apple told me to contact you, the developer. I’ve never had a more frustrating experience in the App Store. I can’t believe it.

I purchased a lifetime membership for the discounted offer of $6.99, then the app charged me for the same membership at the full price of $8.99. I requested a refund from Apple for the duplicate full membership charge and was told that it was “Not eligible for refund”??? This is a scam that Apple is allowing.

title: It is sooo awesome
text:
I use it all the time, it is wonderful. I would totally recommend it to anyone who loves to organize and keep track of things. I can track my goals and keep a list of how I feel and or my moods every month. It is the best personal app I have  EVER had. Please download it you will NOT regret it at all.

Thank you so much this app has helped me active sooo many of my goals and achievements. Thank you

title: Love it!
text: This app is perfect!

title: Very, very cool
text: Helps me with my hobbies, and now I feel free

title: amazing !!
text: love it

title: Misleading subscription
text: I downloaded this app to try for the three day trial then purchase with a one time purchase rate listed in the App Store, however when I tried to do that, the one time rate was gone and I was left with a yearly subscription. Not what I wanted. I was impressed with the one time rate instead of the yearly renewal that this developer offered. Not the case.  Got scammed on this

title: Question.
text: i am very confused. i had 4 trackers. now i can’t add more unless i pay for premium!! no fair.

title: Good for goal oriented people
text:
I’m a goal-oriented person who loves lists and checking things off, so this app is perfect for me.

Using it with my Apple Watch has made daily habits feel like a game. I don’t always have my phone on me, and I tend to ignore notifications, but with the watch, I stay on track and mark tasks off easily.

That said, the Apple Watch version has a small issue—I can’t enter amounts (e.g., logging 24 oz of water or a 30-minute workout). The option to add amounts is there, it just doesn’t work. I have to use my phone, which is mildly inconvenient.

I also wish there was an option for habits every two or three weeks, rather than specific days of the month. I’ve worked around it, but it would be a helpful feature.

title: Free and user friendly
text: Great app for tracking streaks

title: Reliable Support
text: I had an issue finding a setting and gave a poor review. The developer got back to me within a few days and explained what to do. That setting was the only issue I had. Now I’m really looking forward incorporating this app into my routine.

title: Watch App doesn’t sync
text:
I have contacted the support team for this app developer and received no reply. I have the paid version. I have iCloud sync on. My habits don’t show up on my watch. It says “please add a habit in iPhone app first.” I’ve restarted my phone and watch and the app and nothing fixes it.

Edit: developer responded to my review asking me to restart watch and phone. I already wrote in my review that I did this and it didn’t help.

title: Everything you need
text:
Some habit tracking apps are limited to daily goals and can create guilt from not finishing everything that day. This one does not do that.
You can make habits for daily, weekly, and monthly goals then build on them as you integrate it into your routine. You can also customize notifications for a specific goal as a daily reminder. I especially like seeing the weekly and monthly progress pages to compare the habits and see what I’m falling behind on. While the design may not be flashy, it has all the bells and whistles I need to help me accomplish my goals. I highly recommend!

title: Good visualization tools
text: It suits my needs. Good looking styles.

title: Worth a try
text:
I’m enjoying this app now that I know how to use it, what habits I want to track, and I’ve set everything up exactly the way I want, including the colors. Took me a while. Pro tip: don’t worry about daily/ weekly/ monthly habits if you’re random with it. Just set it as a daily habit and see which days you’re more likely to do it. 
I am more motivated to do the habit, as it’s satisfying to tap it off in the app and feel accomplished. 

I have a suggestion for the app developer: 
“Best day” in the weekly tracker section- please replace with the total # of habits accomplished for each day. That way we can see if certain days are easier or harder for doing certain habits.

title: Perfect app for diet and pretty much anything.
text: I am currently using this for my diet and is all I’ve ever wanted besides apple health syncing with vitamins and nutrients but I can manually update it and it’s super flexible and cheap!

title: awesome
text: this app is truly what you need and helped me form many healthy habits that i have been slacking off on

title: great free way for tracking
text: very good for keeping track of what you do in the day

title: Needs a Mac app!
text: Great, but needs an app for Mac! Any plans for this in the near future??

title: Everything is locked
text: Basically every good part of the app is locked behind the paid version, you can make only like 4 habits without premium.

title: Great App!
text: This app can transform your life! Thank you so much to the creators!

title: Update Made Unusable
text: I used to pay for the premium version of this app. As of the last update, or an upload to icloud failure, all of my data disappeared. All of my tracking of my progress towards my habits is gone. I still tried to use the app again but the updates have made this app unusable as far as I’m concerned. It’s no longer user friendly. I create a custom habit and then it’s not findable afterwards. You can try to click a previously tracked habit and it just sends you to the irrelevant suggested habits that you did not create and cannot delete. It’s cluttered and no longer intuitive or quick.  I’m looking for a new app and am so disappointed I will have to start from scratch now.

title: Meh
text: It’s aesthetic and useful, but you can’t even make barely any habit things. You have to pay for a lot. And I want something free. So download if you aren’t going to use it that much or if you don’t mind paying. Great app tho

title: Data loss
text: I like the idea of tracking moods. However, you keep losing data for the past. I have a widget that shows me my moods for the week. Often some past days for the week suddenly turn to black(no mood data at all). As a “tracker”, you should at least making your tracking thing reliable! I subscribed for a year and won’t renew unless this being resolved.

title: Great app
text: Thank you for not being subscription based!!! I use this app daily. Love the addition of the mood tracker. Please don’t change the basics of this app- sometimes simple and easy to use(and pretty) is the best!!!

title: basic but a great app, genuinely helped me get better
text: I previously was frustrated as this app only tracks things in “streaks”, rather than in how much you’ve actually increased in progress. It also doesn’t allow you to skip days or add new goals without upgrading-- however,  they've made upgrading very cheap, and are one of the only apps to offer me a lifetime subscription for a reasonable price (at the price that most apps do per month, but for a lifetime!) they're also pretty generous in what features you can access without upgrading. Overall, this app is fairly basic, but a good deal, and gets the job of tracking your habits done.

title: Deleted
text: Cumbersome and fails to recognize any of my workouts even though it was receiving my Apple Watch and Apple health data. So frustrating to do all the the activities and have it not show up. I relinked everything and restored and still nothing. Plus trying to go back and add work outs in is really hard. It defaults to adjusting on the current day. So it misses workouts and then very challenging to manually record them. Do not recommend this app—

title: I never write reviews…
text: BUT this app has been my most consistently used app for the last 4 years. I’ve customized it so that it looks beautiful (easy to do) and matches my color palette, which may seem like a small thing, but it keeps me coming back. other apps I’ve tried aren’t as customizable. the widget is amazing and really helps me stay on top of my habit building. I’ve gotten my friends to get it too so that we can keep track of each other, and it’s really cool. I love it so much and am grateful it exists. I also love their app “MinimaList.” I highly recommend that too. thank you for these apps!

title: Thank you
text: Thank you for making this app so helpful five stars for sure🍜

title: Buggy
text: I downloaded this app and tried it out, but it was buggy. I couldn’t save new habits and when I closed the app and came back, some of the habits that did save were gone. Definitely wouldn’t pay for this app. Yes, I did download the latest version!

text: I’ve been using this app for years now and loving it up until a few weeks ago. Now it keeps giving me updates on my heart rate every hour and it’s SO ANNOYING. I’ve gone through every setting and turned off every setting for it and it still gives me the notifications. Please fix this HRV setting

title: Ive got a big problem
text:
This app was perfect!! But i just hit the remove button cause i wanted to remove it from home page but instead i deleted the app. I had my sync on and im a life time premium member but when I redownload the app none of my data came back other than the name i had chosen and the fact that im a “lifetime premium member” what should i dooo 😭😭😭 i want my tracks and habits backkk 😭😭😭😭
Let us sign in in our account for saving the data instead of cloud syncing!

title: Really Great App To Organize Your Habits
text: Recently read the book “Atomic Habits”, which motivated me into getting into better habits so I downloaded this app to get started. After having this app for a couple of months, I could definitely say it’s worth to download and buy it, it’s extraordinary.

title: Good structure but buggy
text: Layout is very easy to follow but sometimes buttons/sliders will not work and I have to close out of the app multiple times.

title: THIEVES
text: I NEVER signed up for this app and it charges be $8.99/mo!!! Trying to get this resolved

title: Bug
text:
I have a habit of doing 100 push ups a day. I want to drag a slider to add 20 push for example. It doesn’t allow me to do it. Instead it’s only 0 or 100. 

I can do it by tapping + button a bunch of times but it’s very inefficient.

title: Family sharing doesn’t work
text: Family sharing doesn’t work. I reached out to their support and they stopped responding when they couldn’t fix it. There are lots of habit trackers out there that do the same thing as this one. Go with one that wants your business.

title: Poor set up with Apple health
text: Great potential but very poor set up with Apple health. The categories don’t line up. For example, if you select meditation, it measures mindful minutes instead of mind body which is the correct one.

title: Question please answer!!
text: I’ve had this app for well over a year and I really like it! But I need to change my Apple ID, how do I bring the data from one Apple ID into another?? I have the lifetime membership please reply! thanks!!

title: Very good app
text: it’s a very good app

title: It makes you pay
text: Sorry it looks like such a good app but I looked at it and I got it and it just makes you pay if you wanna use it like you have to get a pro or whatever and it’s like eight dollars a month like OK I could probably find another one that’s way cheaper and doesn’t make you pay, but I guess some people love it if you have money to do it, peace out

title: No family add option
text: Purchased the lifetime family plan and cannot add my daughter as one of the 5 family members. 👎

title: Good but miscounting
text: The app is miscounting my progress. For example, I haven’t had a drink in 27 days, but the app says 24. I checked and I haven’t skipped a single day on the app. The math isn’t adding up and it’s a bit annoying when the whole point of the app is to gamify progress and consistency.

title: Great at getting me motivated
text: I think the interface is easy and colorful and the notification reminders really help me stay on track. It’s been really helping me stay focused on self care and productivity.

title: Skip
text: The reviews looked good so I took a chance on an app without a trial, wish I didn’t. It’s a little clunky and too inflexible. It’s not possible to add or edit tasks within your day so it’s not ideal for weekly goals or if your day to day changes.

title: Great!
text: Super satisfying and easy to use, I love the color scheme and it really inspired me to get my goals accomplished

title: Desktop App is lacking
text: I’ve been using this app for iPhone and iPad for two years and I love it. I even paid for the lifetime membership. I use it for so much and it’s been really helpful to track different health attributes. However, the desktop version for Mac is very glitchy. I was hoping for a more efficient way to update my habits for the year but this is not great. When confirming popup menus, it freezes or lags, I can’t tell which. The button looks grayed out but eventually it accepts the response. It gets the job done but I’m not sure it’s saving me time. I’m trading the small screen/keyboard for longer processing time.
You can only plan 6 tasks before it makes you pay money

title: Phenomenal and Intuitive
text: Seldom does a relatively new app surpass expectations so well. There are several apps out there, but I can tell these developers have paid attention to the competition, and ironed out the issues those competitors had. The UI is minimalist and aesthetically modern and friendly, and it’s so easy to get around. This little app packs a punch with all the touches, habit hiding feature, multiple ways to do something so you’ll find your favorite way of organizing your habit. This app is going to rocket to the top. I also appreciate the reasonable “Buy for Life” without the subscription. Job well done! If I had to nitpick, some of the font placements and sizing are a little out of step with the other elements of the UI, so I look forward to seeing future typographical refinements, but this in no way demerits the overall function of the app.

title: Stop asking for feedback
text: I love this app, but I can’t believe every single day even after I paid it is asked me to rate the app. This is ridiculous.

title: Easy to use
text: I like it. I’m using it to track my music practice but it would be good for all kinds of habit tracking. I’ll probably use it for work too to help me focus on specific tasks for a set amount of time.

title: Bad
text: I don’t write reviews but this app is so annoying. Every time you click on everything the app pops up like 3 different screens asking if you want to leave a review or feedback even after you have said no.

title: Helped me improve my life
text: Got this app in November and had habits until the new year and some things changed and I could keep up for a little bit so I lost the streak so I started some new ones on January 2 and it’s been very helpful to me. Like others have said it’s a gamification of your goals and I have found that very helpful. I use this app in particular instead of the countless others because the UI is very simple and although many people have reported bugs and glitches, I personally haven’t. If you’re serious about your life and you wanna make some changes, I recommend this app.

title: Repeated membership purchase refused to refund
text:
I purchased the lifetime membership of this app, but when I entered the app, it prompted me to purchase again.

I thought the first one didn’t go through, so I paid again. But actually the first one did - so I paid two times!

I contacted both app developers and apple, but neither would provide a refund.

I don’t understand why app developers is asking users to pay for membership twice in a row.

title: Simple, effective, just what I needed
text: This has all that I needed and wanted in a habit tracker, especially for a free version. Easily customizable and helpful to change frequency of goals and types of habits you are looking to establish. Recommend for anyone who is trying to just get into a routine. It’s the little things like the satisfaction of checking yes I flossed every day and keeping your streak going that make it a real habit.

title: Good
text: Good

title: Simple and effective
text: Some trackers have way too much stuff going on. I love how with Habit Tracker you can pick how little or how much you want to do. Customize it to your goals.

title: Perfect
text: It does exactly what I need it to do. You can make it as complicated or as simple as you want. I love that I was able to pay for it once and never have to worry about losing access to it. This app has helped me remember to brush my teeth and wash my face every day. Anytime I worry that I may have forgotten to do it I check this app and feel better. The lock screen widget is also super nice since I don’t even have to open the app just to check my habits. This is the one app where I never have any issues with it working. Which is something I truly appreciate. ❤️

title: Awesome
text: This app has seriously changed my life. I have been able to get my life in order and maintain habits I was previously not disciplined enough to maintain.

title: What Tony the Tiger didn’t say
text: It’s a “Go-o-ood” app. Had it for idk how long— maybe 3-4 years now, but it’s done it’s job. It’s had a few bugs through that time, some seriously annoying but nothing that made me hate it. Personally, I’m not long term goal oriented, I do things that find me joy in the now and this sorta helps seeing those lil day blocks fill in. A lot of the times I fall out of the habit and forget about doing anything in general, but this— get you a chicken salad.

title: Great way to organize my life!
text: This app is flexible and user friendly.  Such a good way to monitor my goals, daily habits and visualize progress!

title: Premium
text: I think this app is great besides the fact that to get over half the stuff you have to pay for premium like all other apps. You can only do a couple habits too! They make it look so great but it really isn’t without premium. If you want to pay I bet it is amazing but if you’re like me and don’t want to then it is not the best app to use.

title: Stop asking for feedback repeatedly
text: Love the app but I keep getting asked to leave feedback over and over again each day.

title: GitHub-Style Year View is a Game Changer
text: The year-view is game changer. Unlike most habit apps that only show recent week, or at best a month, this app lets you see your entire year in one view. If you use GiHub, you know how motivating it is to see this scope of time. Tracking your habits over the course of a year is the appropriate scope because habits often don’t “kick-in” or matter for almost close to a year. Having a year-long target means you’re getting a realistic understanding of the effect of a habit and not just a short snapshot, which doesn’t inform you much about the story of long-term positive change. Habits are fully customizable with frequency, weekly targets, color, name, icon, reminders, duration, units to measure (minutes, hours, miles, kilometers). You can even create your own units! Want to do 100 backflips per day , three days per weeks between Monday - Friday at 11:30AM!? You can do that with this app! This app has, is, and will continue to change my life. Download it now!

title: Perfect
text: I can monitor my water intake

title: So helpful
text: This has been the longest I have been committed to an app. I get on it every morning to see what my goals are for the day and it keeps me accountable and consistent. It’s worth every penny. Get it, you won’t regret it!

title: 𝓐𝓶𝓪𝔃𝓲𝓷𝓰
text: 𝓘𝓽'𝓼 𝓱𝓮𝓵𝓹𝓮𝓭 𝓶𝓮 𝓰𝓮𝓽 𝓻𝓲𝓰𝓱𝓽 𝓸𝓷 𝓽𝓻𝓪𝓬𝓴

I use this app and it gives me motivation. I have ocd(diagnosed since early childhood, severe) and it’s really hard to do the strategies that I have to do to control it that doctors prescribe, and this gives me motivation to not listen to the ocd, knowing that it isn’t just for nothing, and I have the proof that my hard work works right in the app.

title: Vacation Mode

title: Love this app
text: This app keeps me organized and has daily reminders to keep me from being on my phone all day. It does promote to get the pro version quite a lot but I don’t mind it. And I think if your someone who wants to be organized and active this app is for you!

title: Love the app but syncing problems exists between devices
text: I really love this app. I love the way. The layout is, and the interface. It’s really simple to you. Only issue I have is that they do not sync well between devices sometimes I use my iPad and sometimes I use my phone but it does not sync well between both.

title: Complicated

However, two days ago it quit letting me use the back button after adding data for a habit to return to the previous screen. I now have to close the app totally and reopen it to track my next habit.

title: HELP! Back button doesn’t work anymore.
text: I am running the most up to date version of the app on iOS 18.2.1 and as of 1/16/25, when I tap an individual habit to add to its count (ex. logging water ounces), I can no longer tap the top left hand button that returns me to the main habit screen. I have to close the app and reopen. This is super annoying!! Help!!

title: This app Can CHANGE Your Life
text: This app is the real life gamification of my goals. It’s so fun to use the widgets on my Home Screen so I am always reminded of my priorities. This app has helped me have fun while being consistent and sticking to my daily goals. I also love the mood tracking feature that also is a featured widget on my Home Screen. This app helped me train to run a half marathon, it helped me quit smoking, and it’s helping me every day to fight my urge to be a sad lil couch potato and for that I am so thankful.

title: Good

title: App notifies me to do things I’ve already done
text: Sometimes sends me a notification to do things I’ve already done

title: Bugs
text: Please fix glitching issues. When I go to view my moods from over the month it glitches back to my home page. I do not want to delete it and have to rebuy it.

title: Really Ugly
text: I wanted to like the app. The interface is really ugly for something that I’m supposed to use daily and often. It does have the timers and habit event tracking that I’m looking for. The interface of setting units is needlessly busy. The clip art (the Christmas tree sale icon, the sun icon next to the ugly habit logo, etc) shows many terrible design choices. Also, when purchasing this app, I was stuck in a bug that tried to get me to pay again and again even though I had paid once already.

title: Overcharged me
text: In the app it said it would be $12.99 for family lifetime purchase. Actual bill to my credit card was over $31. Poor start to my experience.

title: Great deal for the full version
text: Overall great for tracking habits. A few improvements would be being able to copy habits and make edits instead of having to make each on individually, and also not getting notifications for habits you already crossed off for the day, but overall pretty good.

title: Big help
text: This app is a big help for me to keep track of goals and needs.People who use habit are geniuses.If you are trying to achieve a goal habit is the right app this is two dollars

title: Did not sync with devices
text: I need this to work on both iPad and iPhone without recreating

title: not very intuitive
text: I got the app a couple days ago and i’m having issues adding habits and the layout is just not intuitive. I wish some activities were easier to make a monthly(like on the 3rd friday of the month) or a biweekly activity. Overall not fit for my needs.

title: Easy to navigate
text: The interface is clean, intuitive, and easy to navigate, making it simple to set up and track new habits.

title: App is great but one major thing...
text: I love this app and have for years but what would really make it great is if on all the different the widget layouts and sizes if you clicked on a specific task it would open up to that task specifically so you can quickly add an amount/check off that task instead of just opening the long lists of tasks and you having to find that one in the list somewhere. It makes it more efficient. Make this change and I’ll change my review to a 5 star.

title: Genuinely helpful
text: I’m a 23 almost 24 year old woman who has looked for so many apps to help track my progress and habits that I want to incorporate into my day/week or life in general. You can add anything that you want and choose a logo for it, and edit it to if you want it to be something that you manage to get done every day, specific days of the week or month, or if you want to quit something you can limit yourself to so many of those per day to help you cut down. You can edit pretty much everything to your liking, and when I downloaded it I had a deal to spend a couple dollars to get a chart that made it easier for me to track, the daily things get darker in color depending how many you completed (ex. I made my “drink 10 bottles of water/day” section blue, if I drink all 10 the little square will fill in the blue. If you drink none it stays white, drink some it’s a light blue) and the things you want to quit stay the color you chose if you had none of whatever it is and get darker in color the more you have. like I’m trying to quit drinking, if you exceed the limit that you set then it turns black. Definitely worth downloading and messing around with to see if you enjoy it. I love the way it’s set up it’s genuinely helpful for me :)

title: Can’t do every other day task frequency
text: Wish there was a way to set a task to be done every other day / every 2 days

title: Amo
text: Amo esta app, me cambio la vida, ahora estoy más organizada. Es uy fácil de usar, es muy linda y tiene las herramientas necesarias para combatir con la procrastinación.

title: Love it
text: I j started but it’s fun and keeps me on track😙

title: Needs work on Sharing
text: As an individual tracker the app is great. However, the group feature is extremely lacking. I was hoping that I could create a group to track exercise progress for a group of friends. It seems that all you can do is share your progress via text, not see how everyone is doing on that tab. Perhaps, future app enhancement?

title: Game changer
text: Game changing app! I love the weekly and monthly feature so much.

title: I love it
text: This simple app is helping me improve my health and my relationship with my family.

title: Um, pay again??
text:
I downloaded app, clicked the one time lifetime payment, said “purchase successful”. Then it immediately asked me to “start now” or “leave review”… how can I leave a review if I just downloaded?! Anyway, I clicked start now then there was an error. I checked my bank statement and I got charged $9.74 but it’s not letting me open the app… that’s not cool…. “One time payment” my butt. 

Anyways I’m gonna close everything out and see if it loads. If not, I will repurchase it and call Apple tomorrow for refund. I will update this review if something positive changes but for now, I’m pretty annoyed.

title: In love!
text: I needed to get back in track with a few things, and this app has helped me a lot!!!

title: Unable to add family members even with a family membership
text:
The App will offer you to buy a lifetime family membership but won’t let you add family members or even show the option to do so! I reached out to support via email, chat and even Instagram but heard from no one at all!
This is a scam!

title: Ok app
text: Really wish they would do a “yearly” metric. I wanted to use it as a way to ensure I am taking enough PTO. Also wish you could do your time zone for time rather than 24 hours

title: Zero free options
text: I understand needing to make money off of an app, but this offered ZERO free features. You were required to purchase a subscription. Without knowing if I will like the app, I’m not willing to make a purchase..

title: Just downloaded and it’s perfect
text: This app is perfect. Cheap, pretty, user friendly, easy to read and stay motivated. No notes. Yay!

title: No Family Share!
text: On a functionality standpoint, the app is solid. I love all of the feature sets it provides. But, my perspective, is they have lied about one key price… no family sharing. My only reason to move forward with the purchase was this reason. Very deceptive.

title: So far so good!
text: Everything seems to function! Looking forward to use it more and discover more, support was nice and helped with the fam subscription :)

title: Suggestion
text: Please add more “Health App” metric tie-ins, or better yet, allow us to link to any one of our Apple Health metrics via custom habit creation. I want to “Eat 2000 Calories” which is tracked in Health App under nutrition… but can’t find it in your app. Only stuck with carbs or coffee as your only default nutrition related ones that use Health App data metric sourcing. Thanks.

title: La app de hábitos perfecta

Y casi todo gratis, es un sueño. De verdad la experiencia ha sido fantástica, y me alegra mucho haber encontrado la aplicación. Es perfecta para mi.

title: Minimal support
text: I love this app. It does exactly what I need it to do. However, it won’t sync with my Apple Watch. Everything is set up properly according to the FAQ, but it won’t show my active habits on the watch. Accessing “support” takes you to an AI chatbot that doesn’t work. There doesn’t seem to be a website, either. I’ll still keep using this as I am a lifetime member but I can’t give it five stars due to the sync and support issue.

title: Habit Tracker Review ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: I just got Habit Tracker and it looks impressive I heard that it was good  for keeping track of what you need to do and keeping you motivated. I hope to find some cool features as I use it more, so for now a five!

title: Very buggy
text: The app is  nice and simple, but there are so many bugs. When I tried to put in how many minutes in a day I would be doing my goal, it puts hours instead of minutes. For example, I could put I want to work out for 45 minutes, and it enters as 45 hours. Also, anytime I try to edit a goal like just changing the title, the goal resets to default. These problems make the app hard to use, and I deleted it. Edit: The bugs have been fixed, thank you!
